intro: Phaseolus vulgaris var. gonoleucus, commonly known as the black bean. This variety is characterized by its dark, almost black seeds that are typically oval in shape. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is native to the Americas. The plant produces compound leaves and is often cultivated for its high-protein seeds. It is valued for its nutritional content and is used in various culinary traditions around the world.
